p:
The four invasive plants considered here include R. cathartica, F. alnus, A. petiolata, and R. multiflora. All four of these species are categorized as Restricted by the Minnesota Department of Agriculture
45 , such that it is prohibited to import, sell, or transport propagating parts of these plants in the state. These plants encompass a range of growth habits and habitat preferences spanning a variety of forest types, forest gaps, forest and woodland edges, and managed or developed land. Previous work examining these four species illustrates a range of reported concerns from natural resource and agricultural professionals and forest owners that span conservation, economic, and recreational considerations
46 .
